AppBot Documentation


Welcome


Welcome to the AppBot Documentation! 
 

Invite the bot to your server by clicking the image below. 
 


 
 

Make sure to join 
the support server
 if you ever need any help.
 

If you want to donate and make the bot better 
click here
 

To keep the bot developers encouraged to keep the bot, vote for the bot by 
clicking here
 
 


Content




Getting Started


First Application






Commands


Administrator Commands


Member Commands


Extra Commands
docs.title: Home

docs.text:
Welcome to the AppBot Documentation!    
Invite the bot to your server by clicking the image below.         
Make sure to join  the support server  if you ever need any help.   
If you want to donate and make the bot better  click here   
To keep the bot developers encouraged to keep the bot, vote for the bot by  clicking here
docs.title: Welcome

docs.text: Getting Started  First Application    Commands  Administrator Commands  Member Commands  Extra Commands
docs.title: Content

docs.text:
Getting Started


Making your first application


Thank you for adding AppBot to your server. This section of the documentation will explain how to set up your first application.


Step One
docs.title: Getting Started

docs.text: Thank you for adding AppBot to your server. This section of the documentation will explain how to set up your first application.
docs.title: Making your first application

docs.text:
Commmands


Administrator Commands



The following commands are for users with either the Administrator permission, or for people who have the application reviewing/editing role (if set).








Command


Description










/config


If no applications have been created, this command will create your first one. Otherwise, it's used to create another application, edit the questions of an application, or to reset the bot.
























Member Commands


 
All users without either the Administrator permission, or without the application-reviewing role (if set) are considered members.








Command


Description


Usage
































Extra Commands



These commands are not shown in the regular help command provided the bot.








Command


Description


Usage
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: The following commands are for users with either the Administrator permission, or for people who have the application reviewing/editing role (if set).     Command  Description      /config  If no applications have been created, this command will create your first one. Otherwise, it's used to create another application, edit the questions of an application, or to reset the bot.
docs.title: Administrator Commands

docs.text: All users without either the Administrator permission, or without the application-reviewing role (if set) are considered members.     Command  Description  Usage
docs.title: Member Commands

docs.text: These commands are not shown in the regular help command provided the bot.     Command  Description  Usage
docs.title: Extra Commands

docs.text:
Changelogs





Updates


AppBot is always getting updated, to make it easier for you to know what's getting updated, the change logs are listed here.


Version 1.6.7 - 
/mydata
 minor bug fix




Fixed a bug whre applications without an autorole set would create a bug




Version 1.6.6 - 
/mydata




Added 
/mydata
 for server's applications




Version 1.6.5 - Caps Bug Fix




Fixed a bug where caps while editing an application would make it uneditable




Version 1.6.4 - Application Name Editing




Application names can now be edited




Version 1.6.3 - Logs Bug




Fixed a bug where accepted applications wouldn't get logged or archieved




Version 1.6.2 - 
/register
 enhanced




If you're using the bot as a register bot, 
/reister
 will now make more sence. Instead of something like "Apply for Position", it'll be changed to "Register for position" based off of the command invoked.




Version 1.6.1 - Bug fix




Fixed a minor bug where trying to whitelist a role before blacklisting would cause a bug to occur




Version 1.6.0 - Major bug fixes and minor changes and updates




Fixed a major lasting bug where timing out while creating an application would create a permanently bugged application


Fixed a major lasting bug where you can review an application while the applier was still creating the application


Added 
/help <command>
 to view a specific command's description


Made 
/format
 and 
/apps
 in the same channel rather than in a DM


Changed "amount" to "num_of_qns" in the usage for 
/app create
(Less confusing)


Added 
/register
 alias for 
/apply




Version 1.5.5 - Minor bug fixes




Un-unupdated an update where the cool down message should've sent


Another minor change




Version 1.5.4 - Major Security Bug Fix




Fixed a bug where members without permissions can use 
/app
 subcommands




Version 1.5.3 - Archived Applications




Added 
/setarchieves <channel>
 - set a channel where a copy of applications get sent to the end, after an app gets reviewed


Fixed the message in command cooldown - The bot was supposed to send a message if you ran a command while it was on cooldown




Version 1.5.2




Closed applications will now be crossed out 
like this
 in 
/app list
 and 
/apply




Version 1.5.1




Unreverted an application - accidentally removed discrims from /apps, added back




Version 1.5.0 - Major Update




Added a 
/edit
 command for member answer editing


Fixed some text issues


Fixed a bug where non-utf-8 answers that were longer than 1024 chars would cause a bug 


Added a more descriptive log message for new applications
    
Before: 
Member
 appplied in this server.
    
After: 
Member
 applied for 
Job


Added 
/blacklist
 to set a role that can be given to members to prevent them from applying


Added 
/delete
 to allow members to delete apps that they've submitted


Added 
/app open <app>
 & 
/app close <app>
 for temporarily closing app positions


"Enter a reason that you denied the app" is now embedded


Denying app reason timeout has been extended to 10 minutes


Global announcements can now be configurable


Fixed a small text error where the prefix would not be the correctly invoked one in




Version 1.4.6




Fixed a weird bug that would happen if someone tried to edit an app without an acceptance message




Version 1.4.5




Fixed a bug where missing members caused 
/apps
 to stop working - now they don't show up anymore




Version 1.4.4




Added descriminators in 
/apps
 to make finding users easier




Version 1.4.3




Added a rotating status, fixed the 
/info
 command




Version 1.4.2




Fixed a pretty common bug where appliers enter a negative number if the server has multiple job positions




Version 1.4.1




Added a gif for autorole permissions help




Version 1.4.0




Added an error handler for people who disabled DMs




Version 1.3.4




Fixed the status of the bot




Version 1.3.3




All commands are no longer case sensitive 




Version 1.3.2 - Minor Updates to Help Command




Added 
/support
 command for an invite link to the support server




Version 1.3.1




Added 
/uptime




Version 1.3 - Updated 
/help
 command




The help command is more modern, organized, categorized, and detailed.




Version 1.2.3




Fixed a minor bug where editing application's custom accept messages before 1.2.1 would cause an error




Version 1.2.2 - Bug fixes and Design Improvements




A major bug that prevented editing questions within 
/config




Version 1.2.0 - Considerably Major Update




Handler made for image uploading


Theming (
/settheme hex
) will change the colors of all embeds for the bot


Numbering added to application editing


Made as presence status for the bot


Fixed a bug where deleting an application while members still have applications for the deleting position would cause an error




Version 1.1.3




Added Embed Limits handler


Logs are now in Beta 




Version 1.1.2




The time to reply with an answer has been extended to 30 minutes




Version 1.1.1 - Minor Update/Bug Fixes




Fixed a bug where servers that didn't appear on the database would start spamming the console, fixed by creating a handler that adds them to the database as if they just added the bot


Updated the new 
/help
 command in according to update 1.1.0




Version 1.1.0 - Set a role for Application Reviewing




You can now set a role to be able to edit and view applications with 
/setrole @Role




Version 0.9.2 - Minor Update




Automated Bug Log has been added for faster bug fixes




Version 0.9.1 - New Update




Custom emotes to make reactions look fancier


Autoroles if a member gets accepted for a role


Fixed 
/help
 command for members


Other minor fixes




Version 0.9.0 - Multiapplications




Multi-applications are now supported! You can now have more than one application format for your members! To add another application, type 
/config




Version 0.8.3 - Application Formats




Added 
/format
, so that appliers can easily view the application to get an idea of what questions that they will be answering




Version 0.8.2




Added a feature where appliers can now look over what they put in the application in the end, and able to edit any mistakes they make




Version 0.8.1




The file that holds the data has been shortened all the way up to from originally almost 40000 lines to around 105




Version 0.8.0 - Initial Public Release




After first releasing the bot, the bot has gotten added to a huge server :)
